page.title: 10HOUSING.CALCOT,READING
page.content: The Calcot area is one of the areas designated for extensive housing development in the Reading Plan. Quite quickly,all the available open space,not specifically ear-marked for recreation or council purposes,is being bought up and built upon. The most common 20th century house in the Calcot area is the terrace house.However,the semi-detatched is almost as common. The majority of the houses being built today are semi-detatched.They usually have three bedrooms,some four. Depending on area,house prices range from Â£40,000 to Â£120,000.Most of the houses now being built are open-planned with lawns and gardens. Calcot is favoured by house purchasers because of the available jobs,excellent shopping facilities,and the easy access to the M4 motorway.
